intro: Triolena asplundii, commonly known as the asplundii triolena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
